summary: This is an application for an amended search warrant filed by an FBI Task Force Officer to correct barcode numbers for three hard drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence on July 11, 2019. The document seeks authorization to search the devices for evidence of sex trafficking, enticement, and transportation of minors, and identifies Ghislaine Maxwell and other co-conspirators as targets.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Accused, owner of the searched devices and residence
persons.context: Deceased owner of the devices and the New York residence from which they were seized. The investigation is into his sex trafficking activities and his co-conspirators.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein, charged by a grand jury with conspiring to commit federal crimes. A target of the investigation and search.

persons.name: Henry Pitman
persons.context: Issued the original search warrant (the July 2019 Warrant) for electronic devices in Epstein's New York residence.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: Signed the June 2020 Warrant that expanded the scope of the search of seized devices to include evidence related to co-conspirators.

persons.name: Ona T. Wang
persons.context: The judge before whom the affidavit for this amended warrant application was sworn.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Epstein to commit federal sex trafficking crimes, as per the indictment referenced in the affidavit.

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York Residence
events.description: The FBI executed a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's private residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, seizing multiple electronic devices including the three hard drives subject to this warrant.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died while in custody.

events.title: Issuance of Expanded Search Warrant
events.description: Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein signed a warrant expanding the scope of the search of seized devices to include evidence of crimes involving Epstein's co-conspirators.

events.title: Discovery of Warrant Error
events.description: The prosecution team realized the June 2020 Warrant incorrectly listed the FBI barcode numbers for the three hard drives to be searched, leading to this amended application.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's private residence, referred to as the 'New York Residence')
Southern District of New York (the jurisdiction of the court and location of FBI offices holding the devices)
keyFacts: The FBI seized nine 'Seagate Path 100' hard drives from Epstein's New York home on July 11, 2019, but initially only searched three believed to be originals.
A clerical error in a subsequent warrant (June 2020) listed the barcode numbers for three copy drives instead of the three original drives that were actually searched.
The investigation is actively targeting 'known and unknown co-conspirators' of Jeffrey Epstein, explicitly naming Ghislaine Maxwell.
The search seeks evidence of crimes spanning from 1994 to August 8, 2019, including sex trafficking of minors, transportation of minors, and enticement to travel.
The affidavit confirms that following Epstein's death, the FBI's investigation into his potential co-conspirators 'continued and remains ongoing.'
